Message.Title: Insurance Company Excludes Coverage for Bel-Phen Combo
Message.Msg: ARNA Longs assumptions (on this MB) regarding physicians' rapid adoption of Bel-Phen are misguided and irrational. This combination will not gain traction without definitive FDA- approved clinical study and expanded Belviq label. Current Belviq label cautions against this. Belviq CVOT will take priority to Bel-Phen combo trials. Insurance companies will not approve Bel-Phen at this time-- Phen-Fen was too notorious. For these reasons, off-label prescribing NOT likely to occur from endocrinologists and the majority of internal medical physicians. CRITERIA FOR COVERAGE/NONCOVERAGE Search Catamaran Anti-Obesity Medication Pharmacy Coverage Policy Weight loss/anti-obesity drugs (e.g., benzphetamine, diethylpropion, lorcaserin, orlistat, phendimetrazine, phentermlne or Qsymia) will be considered for coverage under the pharmacy benefit program when the following criteria are met: Patient has a documented body mass index (BMI) ≥ 30 kg/m2 (adult) or BMI in the 95th to 99th percentile for age and gender (children and adolescents 12-18 years of age) OR Patient has a documented BMI 27 kg/m2 with at least one or more of the following obesity- related risk factors: AND o Hypertension o Dyslipidemia o Type 2 diabetes mellitus o Sleep apnea o Coronary heart disease Drug therapy is part of a comprehensive plan which includes diet, physical activity, and behavior therapy AND Medication will not be used in combination with another anti-obesity agent (Please note: QYSMIA is the only 2 ingredient-containing drug approved for weight loss) CATAMARAN, INC. - CONFIDENTIAL AND PROPRIETARY © COPYRIGHT 2012, Catamaran, Inc. All rights reserved. Disclaimer: This document is for informational purposes only. Individual pharmacy benefit plan designs and contract language take precedence over coverage policies. Coverage may vary for Medicare or Medicaid plans. Coverage policies are reviewed and updated periodically.

Topic.Title: may 10

Message.Msg: I think what May 10 is all about whether Alibaba Group going for IPO or not. Also, whether Jack Ma will be the CEO to initiate this IPO, does the roadwork and my take will be 2nd half this year with Summer preparation and IPO in the Fall. Coming out from a blockbuster revenue and earnings report, perfect time to initiate the IPO news. Like I said this is huge to YHOO defending what they will decide the IPO valuation. I say, my personal opinion, will be $60B to $80B, although $100B is possible. I think they want to be conservative here. GS wants a blockbuster IPO for Alibaba, so I stick to my prediction. Bottom line is that this IPO is very, very, positive to YHOO shares. YHOO could definitely hit $30 defending of the reception of the IPO Day. Good luck to all YHOO Longs.

Message.Title: Alibaba and Aliexpress
Message.Msg: The parent company, Alibaba, is in the wholesale bulk merchandise market selling in huge lots. It's subsidiary, Aliexpress, is like a flea market allowing sellers to sell whatever they like including "replicas" or fakes of the real deal. I just ordered a fake TAG HUER watch off Aliexpress. You can also buy fake Breitlings, Rolex's and have to be cautious when purchasing from some of the seller's on Aliexpress. I wonder how these fakers will effect the parent company, Alibaba. Will it damage the Alibaba brand as a reputable Chinese company to deal with or hurt the stock price when it goes public? Just curious what others think.
